ConnectionConfig.description: Describes the possible type of connections that can be defined in the configuration file

ConsumerConfig.description: Describes the configuration of streaming layer, that is Kafka, to be adopted by the service

ControlPlaneConfiguration.description: Describes the service configuration to enable the interoperation with Control Plane

feedbackInterval.description:
Interval in milliseconds that must elapse between two feedback events sent to Control Plane Operator.
It defaults to `3000` ms when not provided during deserialization.

grpcAddress.description: Address to the gRPC server that should receive service feedback events

onCreate.description:
Desired initial state of the Service, to be included in the registration request with the Control Plane.
If not provided, the service will start in `Pause` state.

resumeAfterMs.description:
The number of milliseconds to wait before running the processing logic
when connection with control plane operator failed
and no desired fast data state was ever received.

InitialState.description:
Enum to map the initial state of the service when registering to Control Plane,
according to the value defined in the configuration file.

This state should be used to be mapped to the Piper's ExecState.

commitIntervalMs.description: number of milliseconds between one commit and another

config.description:
librdkafka Kafka consumer configuration properties. Do not include here Kafka configurations
about the Kafka instance and/or connection, as it will be overrided by the selected connection

connectionName.description:
Reference to the Kafka configuration stored inside the Connection (`KafkaConnectionConfig`)

This property is required from version 0.6.0 onwards.

topic.description: name of the Kafka topic from which the consumer will read messages

appName.description:
The application name employed by MongoDB driver when performing queries.
This is useful for debugging purposes, such as recognizing which application
is launching a query towards the database.

database.description: MongoDB database where events will be written to

PersistenceConfiguration.description: Describes the configuration of persistence layer, that is MongoDB, to be adopted by the service

appName.description:
The application name employed by MongoDB driver when performing queries.
This is useful for debugging purposes, such as recognizing which application
is launching a query towards the database.

collection.description: MongoDB collection where events will be written to

connectionName.description:
Reference to the MongoDB configuration stored inside the Connection (`MongodbConnectionConfig`)

This property is required from version 0.6.0 onwards.

database.description: MongoDB database where events will be written to

maxBatchSize.description:
Number of change events that should be buffered before
offloading them in bulk onto the persistence layer

writeIntervalMs.description:
Number of milliseconds that should elapse between two writes
on persistence layer when the maximum batch size is not reached
within the interval

encoding.description: Define which type of encoding the library supports when it needs to read the actual secret value.
Define which type of encoding the library supports when it needs to read the actual secret value.

oneOf.description:
_Insert_ and _update_ operations ensure that fields not found in the `after` payload are
removed from the potentially existing document on the persistence layer.

_Inserts_ are executed as replace or insert operations, while _updates_ remove
the fields at first level that are not present in the `after` payload,
but are found in the `before` payload (use `"$unset"` clause).

_Insert_ operations are treated as upserts, while _Update_ ones do not add the `"$unset"` clause.
Thus fields not mentioned in the after payload will be left untouched.
